data.title: Extra Credit
data.text:
Famous Latin American Bios!

Choose at least five or six famous Latin American people from the list below (or visit Famous Hispanics in History).

On the blank side of an index card draw and color a portrait of one famous Latin American person (one person per index card and your portrait needs to be colored).

On the lined side of each index card write a short biography of each famous Latin American.

Please include the following information:

Person's full name.

Person's place of birth.

Year of birth and of death (only if the person is dead).

What did the person do in his or her life?

What made the person famous?

What do you think made this person special?

What events made or changed this person's life?

Why did you choose this person?

Evita Peron and Site #2 - Argentinian President

José Martí - Cuban Writer and Revolutionary

Eugenio Maria de Hostos - Puerto Rican Patriot, Educator, Sociologist, Philosopher, Essayist, and Novelist

Carlos Santana - Mexican Musician

Sammy Sosa - Dominican Republic Baseball Player

Celia Cruz - Cuban Queen of Salsa

Frida Kahlo and Site #2- Mexican Artist/Painter

Diego Rivera - Mexican Artist

Simón Bolivar and Site #2 - Venezuelan Statesman, Writer, and Revolutionary General

Cesar Chavez - Mexican Civil Rights Activist

Sandra Benitez - Puerto Rican-American Author

Desi Arnaz - Cuban Actor/Musician

Gabriel García Márquez - Colombian Journalist, Novelist, Writer, and Nobel Prize Winner for Literature

Gabriel Márquez

Antonia Novello - Puerto Rican First Female and First Hispanic Surgeon General of the US!

Ellen Ochoa and Site #2 - Mexican-American Astronaut

Luis Leloir - Argentinian Nobel Prize Winner for Chemistry

Julia Alvarez - Dominican Republic Poet

Ileana Ros-Lehtinen and Site #2 - Cuban member of Congress

Henry Cisneros - Mexican-American Mayor and U.S. Secretary of Housing and Urban Development

Gloria Estefan and Site #2 - Cuban Musician

Roberto Clemente Walker and Site #2 - Puerto Rican Athlete and Member of the National Baseball Hall of Fame

Alfonso X "El Sabio" - Spanish King

Emiliano Zapata - Mexican Statesman

Pablo Picasso - Spanish Artist

César Milstein - Argentinian Nobel Prize Winner in Physiology or Medicine

Sister M Isolina - Puerto Rican Catholic Nun (called the Puerto Rican Mother Teresa)

Doña Josefa Ortiz de Dominguez and Site #2 - A herione of Mexican Independence

Pancho Villa - A Mexican revolutionary

Freddie Prinze, Sr (not Junior) - A Puerto Rican Actor

Cesar Romero and Site #2 - A Cuban Actor
